events.title: Gunpowder Plot in England
events.description: A failed attempt by English Catholics, including Guy Fawkes, to blow up the Houses of Parliament and assassinate King James I.
events.significance: It is commemorated annually in the UK on Guy Fawkes Night and symbolizes the struggle for religious and political power.

events.title: First US Presidential Election with Female Voter
events.description: Annie L. James cast the first legal vote by a woman in the United States during local elections in Wyoming, which had granted women suffrage.
events.significance: Marked a major step toward women's suffrage and expanded democratic participation in the US.

events.title: Woodrow Wilson Wins US Presidency
events.description: Woodrow Wilson was elected the 28th President of the United States, representing the Democratic Party.
events.significance: Wilson's presidency would influence major policies including WWI leadership and progressive reforms.

events.title: Richard Nixon Elected US President
events.description: Richard Nixon won the 1968 United States presidential election, marking his return to political power.
events.significance: His presidency would be marked by significant events including the Vietnam War's later stages and the Watergate scandal.

events.title: First South African General Election under Universal Suffrage
events.description: South Africa held its first general election with universal suffrage, electing Nelson Mandela as President.
events.significance: Ended apartheid and initiated a new era of democracy and racial equality in South Africa.
